p.draft-comment: global comment: not just concepts. Almost all of these should say The <fn> element lets you insert a footnote. They are not specific to the concept topic, so remove that throughout, unless the element is in fact concept-specific, like conbody.

lcInstruction.p: The <menucascade> element lets you tag a hierarchy of menu choices (such as File, Save As). Each item inside the <menucascade> element is contained in a <uicontrol> element.

The <dl> element specifies definition lists what is a definition list? How is it different from a glossary entry?. The definition list contains entries, tagged with the <dlentry> element, and each entry contains a term (tagged with the <dt> element) and a definition (tagged with the <dd> element). avoid "is used to". Passive. Global.

stepxmp.pre:
Wild duck species ...

Domestic ducks fall into categories based on weight. These weight classes may help you choose a species based on how much you will need to feed your ducks.

Bantam
The lightest-weight ducks and best fliers, such as the Mallard duck.
Light
The second lightest-weight ducks and best egg-layers, such as the Khaki Campbell duck.
Medium
The mid-weight and generally calmest ducks, such as the Swedish duck.
Heavy
The heaviest and generally friendliest ducks, such as the Pekin duck.
